  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours
    | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday
    Morning | Face The
    Nation 















Hi everyone,
 
It’s getaway day across the country as we gear
  up for the Fourth of July. Roadways and the skies are already showing signs
  of the travel crunch as an estimated 41 million Americans are traveling more
  than 50 miles from their homes. Will that congestion be intensified due to
  heightened security? Nancy Cordes will report on transportation and holiday safety.
 
We’ll also have two reports on the U.K.
  terror plot, including the latest updates on the investigation, arrests and
  intelligence about who was responsible for what could have been very deadly
  explosions.
 
And as so many Americans will be on the road over
  the holiday, I’ll give you a look at a new crash-test study that shows
  your neck might not be as safe as you’d think – even in
  larger-size vehicles.
 
Yesterday, we told you a little about how Bill
  Clinton is stepping up to support his wife’s presidential bid. Tonight,
  Jim Axelrod will have the story from the road with the new team of Clinton
  & Clinton. 
 
And what if someone told you that eating chocolate
  every day could keep the doctor away? Sound more appealing than an apple?
  Michelle Miller will report on the surprising results of a new study.
 
Finally, we’ll leave you tonight with some
  entrancing melodies – and some momentous passings. I hope you’ll
  join us.
 
Thanks!
 




Katie Couric
CouricandCo@cbs.com
